steps.title: Decide what method you'll use to call.
steps.content: Decide what method you'll use to call. To call Costa Rica, you can use a landline, cellular phone, or an internet service like Skype . All of these methods cost money. If you are using a landline or cell phone, you can purchase an international calling card or specialty international service plan through your phone provider. Otherwise, a call from the US to Costa Rica will generally cost: By cellphone - $0.20 per minute By landline - $0.27 per minute By Skype - $0.095 per minute

steps.title: Determine your country’s exit code.
steps.content: Determine your country’s exit code. To begin, you must know the exit code from the country you wish to place the call. You can visit http://www.howtocallabroad.com/ to figure out the exit code for your specific country. For the USA, the exit code is 011 For the UK, the exit code is 00 For Australia, the exit code is 0011

steps.title: Find out the local time.
steps.content: Find out the local time. Before you place a call to Costa Rica, you should determine the local time. You don’t want to phone your friends or relatives during the middle of the night! Visit http://www.howtocallabroad.com/ to check the local time. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Make sure you have the local phone number.
steps.content: Make sure you have the local phone number. Naturally, before you can place a call to Costa Rica, you must have local phone number. This number should be 7 digits long.

steps.title: Dial the “exit code.”
steps.content: Dial the “exit code.” To begin, you will dial the exit code of the country where you are calling. The number of digits in this exit code varies from country to country. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Dial the “country code” for Costa Rica.
steps.content: Dial the “country code” for Costa Rica. Next you will dial the three-digit country code for Costa Rica. Regardless of where you are dialing from, this country code is 506. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Include the 7-digit telephone number.
steps.content: Include the 7-digit telephone number. Finally, you will dial the seven digits of the local Costa Rican individual (or business) you are trying to reach. Double check that you have the correct number before you waste money on a call. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Skip the “area code.”
steps.content: Skip the “area code.” To make a call to Costa Rica, there is no area code required! Once you enter the country code (506), you only need the 7-digit telephone number. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Try using a “plus sign.”
steps.content: Try using a “plus sign.” In some cases, you can substitute a plus sign or “+” for your country’s exit code. If you are having trouble connecting, try skipping the exit code and entering a plus sign instead. [6] X Research source In this case, you would enter: +506-xxx-xxxx

steps.title: Contact the operator.
steps.content: Contact the operator. If you are still having trouble connecting, dial 00 to reach an international operator. The operator can try to verify your number and/or dialing pattern, and help you to connect effectively. [7] X Research source
